com.craftfire.commons.util
Class Version

java.lang.Object
  com.craftfire.commons.util.Version

public class Version
extends Object

A class that represents a version.

Constructor Summary
Version(String version)
          Parses a version from string using default version format (separated with . char, radix = 10).
Version(String version, String separator)
          Parses a version from string using given separator and default radix (10).
Version(String version, String separator, int radix)
          Parses a version from string using given separator and radix.

Parses a version from string using default version format (separated with . char, radix = 10).

separator - the separator used in version parameter

version - the string to parse
separator - the separator used in version parameter
radix - the radix to be used

Returns the string that was used to create the version.

Returns:

getString

public String getString(String separator)
Returns a string representation of the version using given separator.

Parameters:
separator - the separator to use
Returns:
a string representation of the version

getArray

public String[] getArray()
Returns an array of string elements of the version.

For example new Version("1.5.3").getArray() returns an array of "1", "5", "3".

Returns:
an array representation of the version

getSeparator

public String getSeparator()
Returns the separator that was used to create this version.

Returns:
the separator

getRadix

public int getRadix()
Returns the radix of this version.

Returns:
the radix

compareTo

public int compareTo(Version anotherVersion)
Compares two versions.

Note: If common parts of versions are equal and this version is longer than anotherVersion, it means this one is bigger, but if anotherVersion is longer than this one, it means they are equal.

Parameters:
anotherVersion - the version to be compared
Returns:
the value 1 if this version is greater than the version argument; the value -1 if less; the value 0 if equal

inVersionRange

public boolean inVersionRange(VersionRange range)
Checks if the version is within given range.

Parameters:
range - a range to check the version with
Returns:
true if the version is in range, false if not
See Also:
VersionRange.inVersionRange(Version)
